title: Phil Collins, 73, Reveals 'Drumming Has Taken Its Toll' on His Health in Rare Update
text:
By Marisa Losciale ,
1 hours ago
Phil Collins is laying out his reasons for retiring from the drums two years ago in a raw new interview.
In the documentary Phil Collins: Drummer First , which premiered on Wednesday, the eight-time Grammy winner offered intimate details and new insight into his decades-long career, revealing the real reason he had to step away from the kit.

During interviews conducted shortly after Collins announced he was retiring from music in March 2022, he revealed that his decision to put the sticks down—a skill he's practiced since he was about 5—was driven by health reasons.
"I'm 71, I've been playing drums all my life," he said in the doc. "To suddenly not be able to do that is a shock."
"It’s still kind of sinking in a bit," he admitted.
"The drumming has taken its toll on my hands, legs," the "You'll Be in My Heart" artist shared. "I just feel like I've used up all my air miles," Collins, now 73, later joked.
In the Dec. 18 release , the Genesis musician's 23-year-old son, Nic Collins , went into detail about the injuries his father sustained from 50 years of touring. The ailments included back issues over the years followed by a "big surgery on his neck [in 2015] that stemmed from all those years playing drums and bad posture."
It also "caused him to have a drop-foot," Nic said, explaining that his father "has like no sensation" and lacks "control" over his feet, which is why he "can't really play drums" and now walks with a cane.
"If I can't do what I did as well as I did it, I'd rather relax and not do anything," the English musician concluded elsewhere in the documentary. "If I wake up one day and I can hold a pair of drumsticks, then I will have a crack at it."
Phil Collins: Drummer First is now streaming on YouTube.
